messages.title: Tackling flooding, not losing parks
messages.content: Opposes £2.2 billion 'super sewer' project, advocates for local storm relief and protecting green spaces.

messages.title: Better training, less dependency
messages.content: Addressing unemployment by providing school leavers with opportunities and preventing the trap of dependency culture.

messages.title: Better housing and a step up onto the ladder
messages.content: Ensures home availability for all income brackets, supports building mixed communities where diversity is celebrated.

messages.title: Giving power to local people
messages.content: Supports localism, empowering people to have a say on new bars, planning applications, and opposes Labour's model of governance.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Against the 'super sewer' project due to cost concerns, favors alternate flood prevention measures.
Implement programs to help long-term unemployed and school leavers, reduce dependency on benefits.
Make homes available to residents of all income levels, build mixed communities in Hammersmith, support property ownership.
Advocate for localism, giving residents a direct say in local affairs such as licensing and planning.

issues.environment: Opposes costly 'super sewer' project, prefers local flood solutions and protecting green spaces.
issues.governance: Supports giving power to local people over decisions such as the licensing of new bars or planning applications, in contrast to Labour's model.
issues.socialWelfare: Advocates for better training to prevent dependency on benefits.

housing.content: Make homes available to residents of all income levels, build mixed communities in Hammersmith, support property ownership.
